docs.lead_paragraph: Prof. Hubert Herkomer, in a recent lecture delivered at Oxford, spoke rather depreeatingly of art in the Victorian age; that is, as far as England was concerned. "Uncanny dexterity," he thought, was the trouble with the modern school of English art. Why, he asked, were the subjects selected so much by, Engilsh painters from foreign topics?
docs.abstract: Clark, John Bates; "The Distribution of Wealth"
